text: Gonojana tristis is a moth in the family Eupterotidae. It was described by Druce in 1896. It is found in Gambia.Afro Moths The fore- and hindwings are uniform pale brown, both with a dark brown submarginal line extending from the costa to the inner margin. The head, antennae, thorax and abdomen are pale brown and the underside of the thorax and abdomen are pale yellow, while the legs are yellow.Druce, H. 1896. Descriptions of some new species of Heterocera from tropical Africa. - Annals and Magazine of Natural History (6)17(101): 355 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1896 Category:Janinae
title: Gonojana tristis
